title: Similar style to Hoboken High but what is it?
content:
I came across this font while watching an animation called Jesus 2000 and thought it was a well suited font for its use... but can't find a match for it... i've looked at a couple of 'college' fonts like hoboken high but aint having much luck.

I apologize for the image quality but it was a screenshot from the animation.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 11.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2011_13.png) | 35.2 KB |
| [Picture 10.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2010_13.png) | 19.18 KB |
author: McKonkie

comments.content:
You can edit your posts - no need to repost your corrections.

Look for "college" fonts like [http://www.dafont.com/allstar.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/www.dafont.com/allstar.font "http://www.dafont.com/allstar.font")

A google search for "college fonts" might help too.

Similar:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/")  
wich has a serifed E crossbar.

Also:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104 "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104")

sorry i had a temporary internet problem and accidently posted the topic twice.

I've tried these various searches already to no success... which is why i brought it to Typophile. I wouldn't want to waste peoples time without honestly looking for it myself first and running it through other 'font id' forums.

I think Jeff Levine's [Return Pass](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165034/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/return-pass/) may be a better alternative, since the R is the right style. All it needs (I think) is to add the serif to the arm of the E.

- Mike Yanega
